etymology.description: Phonetic: 尚(尚) (shàng) + Semantic: 旨(旨) (zhǐ, "tasty") = relating to flavor -> taste; try
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 尚(尚) (shàng) for its similar sound with 旨(旨) (zhǐ, "tasty") to convey the idea of experiencing or trying different flavors.
etymology.simplification: 尝(嘗) replaces the complex 龍(龍) (lóng, "dragon") with a simpler phonetic 尚(尚) (shàng), while retaining the essential meaning with 旨(旨) (zhǐ, "tasty") component.

examples.chinese: 我想尝这个菜(我想嘗這個菜)。
examples.english: I want to taste this dish.

examples.chinese: 他尝了果汁(他嘗了果汁)，觉得味道不错(覺得味道不錯)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cháng le guǒ zhī, juéde wèidào búcuò.
examples.english: He tasted the juice and thought the flavor was good.
